meta.title: Sheboygan Area School District - School Closure Grab-n-Go Meals

div.h2: SASD Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

div.div:
UPDATE: Gov. Evers announced that he has extended the Safer at Home order to 8 a.m. Tuesday, May 26 which includes the closure of all public and private K-12 school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Virtual learning will continue through June 11.
Read More >

h2.strong: The Sheboygan Area School District will offer FREE Grab-n-Go breakfast and lunch.

p.em: *The Sheboygan Area School District will continue to observe Friday, April 10 and Monday, April 13 as planned. No virtual learning or grab-n-go meals will be offered on these No School Days.

td.p: This service will be available from 7:30 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. to any child 18 years of age or younger in the local community, even if they are not a student at SASD.

UPDATE: The Department of Public Instruction has revised its policy. Children DO NOT need to be present when picking up meals. Adults may pick up meals on behalf of their children. No identification needed.
Meals are available for pickup at the main entrance of select schools which include:

ul.li: South High School, 1240 Washington Ave (*Pick up at the south entrance to the commons closest to Washington Ave.)

td.p: Parents or children may stop in anytime between 7:30 and 11 a.m. to grab a breakfast and lunch meal to take home. Parents are welcome to drive right up to the door.
Meals will not be eaten on site.
